intro: Sieruela rubelloides, commonly known as the red-stemmed sieruela, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sieruela rubelloides is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and stream banks.
